angle.gpt4o_check_answer_description: The angles on a straight line add up to 180¬∞. The angle next to Œ± is 180¬∞ - 130¬∞ = 50¬∞.

angle.orig_question:

angle.new_question_description: Instead of asking for the bisected angle ‚à†DBF, ask for the whole angle ‚à†ABF while keeping the same angle relationships and expressions.
angle.new_question: {If ray BD bisects ‚à†ABF, and m‚à†FBC = 2x + 25 while m‚à†ABF = 10x ‚Äì 1, what is the measure of ‚à†ABF? A. 129¬∞  B. 118¬∞  C. 141¬∞  D. 152¬∞}
angle.new_answer_description: Because BA and BC are opposite rays, ‚à†FBC and ‚à†ABF form a linear pair, so their measures sum to 180¬∞. Thus  (2x + 25) + (10x ‚Äì 1) = 180 ‚Üí 12x + 24 = 180 ‚Üí x = 13. Substituting into m‚à†ABF = 10x ‚Äì 1 gives 10(13) ‚Äì 1 = 129.
angle.gpt5_check_answer_description: A, B, C are collinear, so ‚à†ABF + ‚à†FBC = 180¬∞. Set (10x ‚àí 1) + (2x + 25) = 180 ‚áí 12x + 24 = 180 ‚áí x = 13. Then ‚à†ABF = 10x ‚àí 1 = 10(13) ‚àí 1 = 129¬∞.
angle.gpt41_check_answer_description: Since BD bisects ‚à†ABF, m‚à†ABD = m‚à†DBF. But ‚à†FBC = ‚à†DBF = 2x + 25, and ‚à†ABF = 2‚à†DBF = 2(2x + 25) = 4x + 50. Set equal to ‚à†ABF‚Äôs expression: 4x + 50 = 10x ‚Äì 1 ‚áí 51 = 6x ‚áí x = 8.5. Plug x back: ‚à†ABF = 10(8.5) ‚Äì 1 = 85 ‚Äì 1 = 84.
angle.o3_check_answer_description: ‚à†ABF and ‚à†FBC form a straight angle, so (10x ‚àí 1) + (2x + 25)=180 ‚Üí12x+24=180 ‚Üíx=13; then ‚à†ABF=10(13)‚àí1=129¬∞
angle.gpt4o_check_answer_description: Since ray BD bisects ‚à†ABF, m‚à†ABD = m‚à†DBF = (1/2) * m‚à†ABF. Also, m‚à†FBC = m‚à†DBF. Hence, 2x + 25 = (1/2) * (10x - 1). Solving, 4x + 50 = 10x - 1. This gives 6x = 51, so x = 8.5. The measure of ‚à†ABF is 10(8.5) - 1 = 84.
angle.gpt5_orig_answer_description_check: AB and CB are opposite rays, so ‚à†ABF + ‚à†FBC = 180. Solve (10x‚àí1)+(2x+25)=180 ‚Üí x=13. Then ‚à†ABF=10(13)‚àí1=129. Since BD bisects ‚à†ABF, ‚à†DBF=129/2=64.5.
angle.gpt41_orig_answer_description_check: Since BD bisects ‚à†ABF, ‚à†DBF = (1/2)‚à†ABF. Given ‚à†FBC = 2x+25 and ‚à†ABF = 10x-1, since ‚à†FBC + ‚à†ABF = 180 (linear pair), so 2x+25 + 10x-1 = 180 ‚áí 12x = 156 ‚áí x = 13. ‚à†ABF = 10x-1 = 129, so ‚à†DBF = 129/2 = 64.5.
angle.o3_orig_answer_description_check: BA and BC form a straight line, so ‚à†ABF + ‚à†FBC = 180 ‚Üí (10x‚àí1)+(2x+25)=180 ‚Üí x=13. ‚à†ABF = 10(13)‚àí1 =129. BD bisects ‚à†ABF, so ‚à†DBF = 129/2 = 64.5.
angle.gpt4o_orig_answer_description_check: Since BD bisects ‚à†ABF, ‚à†DBF = ‚à†ABF/2. Given ‚à†FBC = 2x + 25 and ‚à†ABF = 10x - 1, ‚à†FBC + ‚à†ABF = 180¬∞. Solve for x: 2x + 25 + 10x - 1 = 180, 12x + 24 = 180, x = 13. ‚à†ABF = 10(13) - 1 = 129. ‚à†DBF = 129/2 = 64.5.

angle.gpt5_orig_answer_description_check: Since VY is a diameter, ‚à†VZY = 180 = ‚à†VZU + ‚à†UZY = 4x + (2x + 24) ‚áí x = 26. Then ‚à†VZU = 104 and ‚à†UZY = 76. Let a = ‚à†WZX = ‚à†XZY. Using WU as a diameter, ‚à†WZU = 180 = ‚à†WZV + ‚à†VZU ‚áí ‚à†WZV = 76. Around the circle: ‚à†WZV + ‚à†VZU + ‚à†UZY + ‚à†YZX + ‚à†XZW = 360 ‚áí 76 + 104 + 76 + a + a = 360 ‚áí a = 52. Arc WUX = ‚à†WZU + ‚à†UZX = 180 + (76 + 52) = 308.
angle.gpt41_orig_answer_description_check: VY and WU are diameters, so they split the circle into semicircles. The angles at the center add up to 360¬∞. coordinate.gpt4o_check_answer_description: The largest ellipse that can fit inside a 40 cm by 20 cm rectangle has semi-major axis a = 20 cm and semi-minor axis b = 10 cm. The area of the ellipse is œÄab = œÄ(20)(10).
